question: What is a megagame?
answer: What it says on the tin – big games (like, really big). A megagame blends aspects of role playing, strategy, and board game style mechanics, running usually over the course of a day, and can be attended by anywhere between 30 – 200 players.

question: Who can play a megagame?
answer: Anyone! Most of our games are appropriate for people under 18, and we encourage anyone who wants to get involved to reach out to us.

question: When is your next game?
answer: Unfortunately we currently have no scheduled games due to the Covid-19 pandemic lockdown in Victoria

question: I missed out on a game, will you run the same one again?
answer: We do our best to accommodate the maximum number of players at our games, and if there’s enough interest, we’ll run the same game multiple times in succession.

question: How can I stay up to date on game announcements?
answer: Follow us on Facebook, or sign up to our mailing list by emailing melbournemegagames@gmail.com.

question: Do I have to have a group of friends to play a megagame?
answer: Not at all, some of our games are geared towards teams, but we always do our best to accommodate everyone who signs up.

question: What information can I expect about the game?
answer: When you sign up to a game, you’ll be emailed a copy of the rules, and any other resources you need, a week before the game runs.

question: I don’t see my accessibility needs catered for, but I still want to play, what should I do?
answer: Let us know. We’re passionate about bringing megagames to as wide of an audience as possible, and we’re always willing to work on solutions.

question: How can I get involved in helping run games?
answer: Talking to us at a game is usually the best way of making us aware of your interest.

question: I want to design a game, can you help?
answer: Yes we can! Check out our Resources page for more information for prospective designers.
